intro: Microloma hystricoides, commonly known as the spiny bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
